title: Temporary SEC Leadership Is Set After Chairman’s Recent Departure
sub_head: Elad Roisman is expected to succeed Jay Clayton during final weeks of President Trump’s term
body:
WASHINGTON—Elad Roisman is expected to lead the Securities and Exchange Commission after Chairman Jay Clayton’s recent departure, a fellow commissioner at the agency said Thursday.
Mr. Roisman, a Republican commissioner at the SEC, is likely to run the commission for just the few weeks that remain in President Trump’s term. The pick hasn’t been announced by either the SEC or the White House.
Mr. Clayton’s final day at the commission was Wednesday.
The SEC, which oversees the country’s securities markets, is a five-member bipartisan commission led by someone chosen by the president.
One of the commission’s two Democrats—Caroline Crenshaw or Allison Lee—will likely be appointed to the leadership role in an acting capacity after President-elect Joe Biden takes office on Jan. 20, Inauguration Day.
